description: From under- +‎ -wear. Compare Dutch ondergoed, German Unterwäsche, Swedish underkläder.

entries.meaning: Clothes worn next to the skin, underneath outer clothing.
examples: Don't scratch and bite, my little bear, you'll soon need bigger underwear.

entries.meaning: (colloquial) Underpants (boxers, briefs, panties, etc) and often bras.
examples: “A thong,” she answered him breathlessly. Now completely turned on by the fact that his man was sniffing her underwear and grinning like a tiger that took down its prey. That is if tigers could smile and still look sexy.
